definition[0]: if something sticks out, you notice it because part of it comes out further than the rest of a surface
example[0]: The children were so thin their ribs stuck out.
example[1]: Paul’s legs were sticking out from under the car.
definition[1]: to continue doing something that is difficult, painful, or boring
example[2]: It wasn’t a happy period of his life, but he stuck it out.
definition[2]: to risk giving your opinion about something, even though you may be wrong or other people may disagree with you
example[3]: I’m going to stick my neck out with some predictions for the next two years.
definition[3]: to seem more important to someone than other people or things
example[4]: The thing that sticks out to me is that they need more help than they’re getting.
